EmailTemplate.subject: Save the Date! ASA Invites you to a Regulatory Update
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Are you struggling to manage your day-to-day responsibilities and stay on top of all of the imminent regulatory changes?
American Student Assistance (ASA) can help. We would like to invite you to an informal, 2 hour regulatory update.
Dates, Times, and Locations:
Friday, October 10, 2008 8:30 am – 11:30 pm (Continental breakfast will be provided.) College of the Holy Cross, Worcester
Friday, October 10, 2008 1:00 pm – 4:00 pm (Lunch will be provided.) Mount Holyoke College, South Hadley
Tuesday, October 14, 2008 8:30 am – 11:30 pm (Continental breakfast will be provided.) American Student Assistance, Boston
Who Should Attend School financial aid administrators interested in the most up-to-date information.
How You Will Benefit A quick first glimpse of some of the changes drafted into the Higher Education Act Reauthorization Bill. We will review Higher Education Opportunity Act of 2008 (HR 4137) as passed into law on August 14, 2008. While it's early in the game to discuss details and implementation, this session can give you a head start on knowing what to expect. You will also have the opportunity to have your questions answered.
How to Register - Online at http://www.amsa.com/fap/training - Email your name, institution, and phone number to training@amsa.com - Call ASA's Training Department at (800) 999-9080 ext. 3099
All of ASA's training events are offered free of charge. Training is considered one of the guarantor's core responsibilities and ASA is dedicated to providing informative and useful training events for our industry colleagues.
Dates: Friday, 10/10/08 Tuesday, 10/14/08
Locations: College of the Holy Cross, Worcester
Mount Holyoke College, Souh Hadley
American Student Assistance, Boston
